<title level="1" right="Spell 3" pfs="Standard">
[Levitate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1584)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 340 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

**Deity**
[Nethys](/Deities.aspx?ID=288)

**Lesson**
[Lesson of the Flock](/Lessons.aspx?ID=27)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 unattended object or willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 5 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You defy gravity and levitate the target 5 feet off the ground. You can Sustain the spell to move the target up or down 10 feet. A creature floating in the air from _levitate_ takes a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls. A floating creature can spend an Interact action to stabilize itself and negate this penalty for the remainder of its turn. If the target is adjacent to a fixed object or terrain of suitable stability, it can move across the surface by climbing (if the surface is vertical, like a wall) or crawling (if the surface is horizontal, such as a ceiling). The GM determines which surfaces can be climbed or crawled across.
name: Levitate
